column5: I headed out this morning to my local pike hole.  Water levels were really high.  Spent about 2 hours washing a dozen different lures.  Had a couple of follows but nothing looked to be biting.  I was getting ready to pack it in when suddenly "Wham!" fish on.  This guy put up a good little scrap including many head shakes.  He took my perch xrap pretty deep but suprisingly he blasted off when he was re-introduced to his home.    First fish of 2007 and I can't beleive it came from soft water in early January.  Cheers,  Corn Nug
nice little one, at least ya got one...
nice, its always the last cast which pays off the most. Congrats on the first fish of 07
Way to go Corn, sorry I could not join ya....Next time.  Sherriff
Cute. I wonder if the toxins are low enough for consumption. Pike that size can be good, 'cept fer the bones.

Sherriff - It's to bad you couldn't make it.  It was a very nice crisp morning out there.  Clampet - I'm actually allergic to fish but some of my buds have kept them for the pan.  They're all still alive and somewhat normal after eating them.
Great report and congrats on your first fish of 2007!  Your hard work and dedication paid off this time!  Nice Pike too!
way to go nice pike, cool pic
Way to go Corn.......Feels damn good finally catching ur 1st fish of 2007 huh!
Right on CN! can't complain there!  I'm having fun with this whole steelheading thing but I do miss the summertime bite!!  Cheers, UF
I'm always "Grateful" when the scrappy guys hit.  They do bolt back pretty good even after they take a hook deep.  Good one!
Nice pike. Love the markings on the fins. Looks like camo (I guess it is). Sweet. I'm Jones'n for some pike action now. Thanks LOL.
nice little one to start off the year
